Package oop.ex5.main

Class Scope

java.lang.Object
oop.ex5.main.Scope
Direct Known Subclasses:
Method, Scondition
public class Scope extends Object
This class represents a scope in the s-Java program. each instance of this class is an individual scope (starts with a valid s-Java code line with an opening bracket at its end, followed by a single closing bracket). In this program, an instance of this class may be one of the three: a general scope, a method defined scope or a condition (if/while) defined scope.

  • Constructor Details

    • Scope

      public Scope​(List<String> scopeData, Scope outerScope, String name)
      The Scope Class constructor.
      Parameters:
      scopeData - The scope code lines.
      outerScope - The scope which wraps this scope.
      name - The scope name.

  • Method Details

    • singleLineCommand

      public void singleLineCommand​(String line) throws VariableError, oop.ex5.main.InvalidCommand, oop.ex5.main.InvalidMethodCall, oop.ex5.main.InvalidSyntax
      Processes all the single line command: 1. new Variable declarations. 2. a Method call. 3. a return statement. 4. existing Variable assignments.
      Parameters:
      line - The single line command.
      Throws:
      VariableError - Possible when trying to declare or assign a variable.
      oop.ex5.main.InvalidCommand - If there is an invalid command in one of the scope lines.
      oop.ex5.main.InvalidMethodCall - If a method is called not from the global scope.
      oop.ex5.main.InvalidSyntax - In case of an invalid s-Java syntax.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Getter for the scope name.
      Returns:
      This scope name.
